issue.title: Fix to allow app to support multiple zones
issue.body:
Issue:  The index.js script currently does not support multiple zones.  

Fix:  Updates to index.js and config.js to support multiple zones and number of times per zone to run.

[updates.zip](https://github.com/drj-io/bhyve-zone-interval/files/7448000/updates.zip)

issue.title: Fix to allow app to support multiple zones
issue.body:
Issue:  The index.js script currently does not support multiple zones.  

Fix:  Updates to index.js and config.js to support multiple zones and number of times per zone to run.

[updates.zip](https://github.com/drj-io/bhyve-zone-interval/files/7448000/updates.zip)

comment.body: Hi, sorry it took a year+. I like this feature so I updated the current version to support an array of zones.  While I didn't use your code directly, it basically uses the same concept. Thanks a lot for the suggestion! Now I can set it all up and it'll blow out my whole system!

commits.message: clean up code and update readme

issue.title: Unable to get SAML to work with Google Workspace.
issue.body:
### Debug mode

- [X] I have enabled debug mode
- [X] I have read [checked the Common Issues page](https://snipe-it.readme.io/docs/common-issues)

### Describe the bug

I'm unable to get SAML to work with Snipe and Google Workspace. 



### Reproduction steps

Add the SAML app to Snipe according to instruction here: https://snipe-it.readme.io/docs/saml



### Expected behavior

Integration should work. We get 
Error: app_not_configured_for_user


### Screenshots

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/444485/180877396-e7195be3-046f-4c76-a385-cd3ee6d789fb.png)



![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/444485/180877883-862a3909-2767-4454-842c-609ecf387a62.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/444485/180877965-4d5e3242-732b-4d5f-97a0-dd83cecb7268.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/444485/180878789-86b71ecf-f6e1-4528-b740-84ec5556229f.png)


### Snipe-IT Version

Hosted version 6.0.8 Build 8409 (master) 

### Operating System

Hosted by Snipe

### Web Server

Hosted by Snipe

### PHP Version

Hosted by snipe

### Operating System

_No response_

### Browser

_No response_

### Version

_No response_

### Device

_No response_

### Operating System

_No response_

### Browser

_No response_

### Version

_No response_

### Error messages

```shell
Error: app_not_configured_for_user
```


### Additional context

Is there something that we need to add for Attribute mappings? If so I didn't see that in the documentation. Thank you!

comment.body:
@alanivey docs say up to 24 hours, though it seemed like it too longer for us. I was not the one that finished the integration, so that's all the info I have. 

I'm going to go ahead and close this issue given that our case is fixed.  Cheers!

Is there something that we need to add for Attribute mappings? If so I didn't see that in the documentation. Thank you!

comment.body:
@alanivey We actually got this working. Our Attribute Mapping field is blank and there are no fields mapped in the GW configuration.

Best of luck!
